section.title: Creating the Component Dynamically Using Java
Details of Usage
section.para: The <rich:dataList> component allows to generate a list from a model.

The component has the "type" attribute, which corresponds to the "type" parameter for the "UL" HTML element and defines a marker type. Possible values for "type" attribute are: "disc", "circle", "square".
section.programlisting:

section.para: In the example the "rows" attribute limits number of output elements of the list.
"first" attribute defines first element for output. "title" are used for popup title. See picture below:

The component is created basing on the <a4j:repeat> component and as a result it could be partially updated with Ajax. "ajaxKeys" attribute allows to define elements that are updated after an Ajax request.
section.programlisting: ... <rich:dataList value="#{dataTableScrollerBean.allCars}" var="car" ajaxKeys="#{listBean.list}" binding="#{listBean.dataList}" id="list" rows="5" type="disc"> <h:outputText value="#{car.make} #{car.model}"></h:outputText> </rich:dataList> ... <a4j:commandButton action"#{listBean.action}" reRender="list" value="Submit"/> ...
section.para: In the example "reRender" attribute contains value of "id" attribute for <rich:dataList> component. As a result the component are updated after an Ajax request.

section.title: Look-and-Feel Customization
section.para: For skinnability implementation, the components use a style class redefinition method. Default style classes are mapped on skin parameters.
There are two ways to redefine the appearance of all <rich:dataList> components at once:

listitem.para: Add to your style sheets style classes used by a <rich:dataList> component

section.title: Definition of Custom Style Classes
section.para: On the screenshot there are classes names that define styles for component elements.

section.para: In order to redefine styles for all <rich:dataList> components on a page using CSS, it's enough to create classes with the same names and define necessary properties in them.
To change styles of particular <rich:dataList> components, define your own style classes in the corresponding <rich:dataList> attributes.
